resources.string: Bucharest is the bustling capital city of Romania. Home to over two million people, and maybe even more ways to spend your time, you are guaranteed to enjoy your stay here. We\'ve compiled a list of locations to visit, so you can get the most out of your time here. Enjoy your stay!
Oops! Looks like your location service is currently disabled. Consider enabling it so we can provide you with a better experience.
Stunning Park close to the Village Museum.
Situated in the city centre, great for taking a break from the crowded atmosphere.
A communist era park built on a hill, providing beautiful vistas.
A natural oasis at the heart of the biggest residential district in the city.
A child-oriented park, featuring many attractions.
An open air museum with traditional romanian village houses.
A large biology museum, with lots of stuffed animals and skeletons from different eras. Great for children.
An art museum focued on religious paintings and important historical events.
Huge government building built in times of poverty for the former dictator Ceausescu .
Famous concert hall, featuring impressive fresques.
The old city centre provides numerous shops, restaurants and cafes.
Huge shopping mall with an amazing cinema.
Nature-inspired mall with a great store variety.
Newly renovated mall, very close to the city centre
Large new mall with exclusive brands.
Cozy nightclub, situated in the Old Town, rather cheap.
Youth oriented nightclub, located in student district.
